title: False Detection Ban take 2 (Riot come at me, bro)
body:
Been playing since the long dark days of pre-season one. Joined right after closed beta ended.
My girlfriend who I taught how to play, who I live with, who I have bought many, many skins and champions for to help her excel at this game got falsely banned by your "Flawless" Detection service.
Let's be honest, AVG is a darn good anti-virus but for a long time was falsely flagging your program as a virus. As did AVAST and Norton. Those programs STILL have issues with your coding.
What makes you think you can claim a program you created cobbled together by bribing the people who make the same programs you're hunting is flawless?
It took you how long to fix certain game breaking bugs that should have never hit launch?
You're right, the code is different. Your detection software isn't the same as the code used in the game.
However, it's likely made to detect a code being injected into the game to change how it runs. A code that changes sound files while they're read and output could theoretically cause a false flag detection but your two employees who read her request replied with your copy pasted bureaucratically wrote and designed cookie cutter email instead of treating a customer as a person.
This is me attempting to form a dialogue and not insult you, hell I love your game, I defend your company a lot but all I'm asking for is a little decency.
So, et tu, Riot?
Edit: For clarification despite the fact no one who is down voting or calling me an a-hole or telling me to have her open a ticket has actually read this or any other post fully.
She opened a ticket, they said no. We still have an open ticket despite that.
Evidence? You want a picture of the email saying she was permanently banned? You want a link to the program that she was using the replace voice overs? Why? You're not going to help me get a rioter here. You're just going to be derisive. If you're not going to be helpful, leave. :)

replies.body: They usually dont remove bans, since there's usually no way to prove anything of what you've said, unless they try it themselves.

They actually do. Been here a long time. False detections get removed all the time. Life time bans on players get removed.
I'm not willing to sit down about this. Their program is crap and the two "Specialists" copy pasting without reading are crap too.

Well it has happened to me before, when i was in the middle of something in a game, but opened another game anyway and the anti-cheat program actually detected the other game as a third party/cheating software.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us

Already tried, they responded with their cookie cutter responses. I'm cutting through it to get someone who will treat me like a person and not a ticket number they need to get rid of.
Also, +1ing you for giving an example of another false flag. So much for "Flawless" 'eh riot?

So what exactly did she get banned for? It's pretty rare for Riot to hand out a permanent ban with no warning first. Furthermore, Riot has said many times that no permanent ban is done by an automated system and that each case is reviewed by a Riot employee.
It was for use of 3rd party applications that interfere with the game. Frankly, nothing anybody here on the forums can help with.
Did they say what third party programs she used that were against the terms of use?  Was she using any third party programs (even if they didn't give an advantage?)

She was using a program that replaces sound files with ones outside the native dialect that the game is using.
So instead of North American voice over you might hear Korean or even Chinese.
Edit: And no, they won't give any information on what they thought they detected. They feel it will jeopardize the "Integrity" of their investigation.

Its possible they thought the program provided some auditory queue that assisted the other players (like a ping when the jungler was in view or a ping when a skill shot was used.)  You might get somewhere with them if you let them know what program you were using.

That said, Riot can ban you for using any third party programs, even if they don't give an unfair advantage.  Yeah it sucks that she got banned and that she didn't do anything really wrong but you can't really blame Riot for the ban.  Riot owns the property and if you alter that property without their permission they are perfectly within their right to ban you.

Curious, as I feel that falls more in the realm of custom skins. 
That said, based on Riot's stance that no application or modifications my "interfere with the client or game environment between pressing 'play' and the post-game screen", I would actually think that both custom skins *and* custom VO's would qualify as things they don't allow.

If they *are* suddenly banning for custom skins and/or VO's, I feel like these were common enough for a long time that Riot should make an announcement stating as much, make it highly visible in the client (possibly even a pop-up), and give players a cut-off date for when they need to have such things removed.

The program they use looks for irregularities in the client. It COULD hit someone for replacing their files all together, a lot of times it just breaks your installation and you spend two days repairing. I could link the program here she was using but it's not going to change the board's mob mentality.

AVG and Avast likely are thinking the -peer to peer- bit might be unsafe, because technically it is and it was highly recommended to turn that setting off. Even Riot employees told people to turn that setting off and remove the old program that was used, PandoMediaBooster. 

Other than Pando, I've used Avast and AVG for the last 3 years I've played this game, going on 4 years, and I've NEVER had ANY issues where they though League was a virus. Heck, I'm using AVG right now. lol.
